syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Biology 9700

learning_objectives.description: outline the theory of evolution as a process leading to the formation of new species from pre-existing species over time, as a result of changes to gene pools from generation to generation
discuss how DNA sequence data can show evolutionary relationships between species
explain how speciation may occur as a result of genetic isolation by: geographical separation (allopatric speciation); ecological and behavioural separation (sympatric speciation)
